meanings.definition: A type of Mexican sweet bread
meanings.sent1: I love to eat conchas for breakfast with a glass of milk.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street sells delicious conchas every morning.
meanings.sent3: When the conchas heard they were going to be eaten, they tried to hide in the bread box!
meanings.sent4: The conchas on the plate looked like colorful seashells waiting to be savored.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked conchas filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: The outer ear shell of a mollusk
meanings.sent1: The conchas of the seashells help protect the mollusk's delicate ears.
meanings.sent2: She found a beautiful concha on the beach and admired its intricate design.
meanings.sent3: The mollusk complained that the conchas were too big for its tiny ears.
meanings.sent4: The conchas on the seashore whispered secrets of the ocean to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The conchas of the mollusks shimmered in the sunlight, adding a touch of magic to the beach.

meanings.definition: A type of seashell with a spiral shape
meanings.sent1: Collecting conchas along the shore is my favorite beach activity.
meanings.sent2: The conchas in her collection varied in size and color, each one unique.
meanings.sent3: The hermit crab couldn't decide which concha to call home, they were all so pretty!
meanings.sent4: The conchas scattered on the sand created a beautiful natural mosaic.
meanings.sent5: As the waves washed ashore, they revealed hidden conchas glistening in the sunlight.
